metadata.dc:author: Santalla-Castro, C
Peña-Suárez, J
Burgueño-Montañés, C
metadata.dc:description: CLINICAL CASE A 33-year-old male diagnosed with Parinaud's syndrome, exotropia and post-papillary oedema optic atrophy in his left eye. A pineal germinoma was diagnosed after performing neuroimaging scans and a stereotactic biopsy. He was treated with chemotherapy and radiotherapy, showing a complete pathological response. The Parinaud's syndrome persists one year after diagnosis and the patient has refused to have strabismus surgery. DISCUSSION Parinaud's syndrome consists of a supranuclear vertical gaze palsy resulting from damage to the midbrain tectum. The involvement of adjacent structures leads to the «Parinaud-plus» syndrome. When a Parinaud's syndrome is accompanied by diplopia («Parinaud-plus» syndrome), extension of the injury into adjacent areas must be considered.

metadata.dc:title: Síndrome de Parinaud «plus» en paciente con disgerminoma.
Parinaud «plus» syndrome in a patient with dysgerminoma.
